page.title: 09WIGAN HOSPICE
page.content: Wigan Hospice was founded in October 1981 by Doctor Surman who realised there was a need for one in Wigan. The hospice is a large house that has been extended and converted. The wards open onto a green landscape with a view over Scotman's Flash. The first patients were admitted in September 1983 and the hospice was officially opened by the Mayoress of Suffolk in 1984. It is run by a matron, twenty qualified nurses, three home care nurses and many volunteers. The money for the hospice was raised by{public {donations.}It has ten beds, five funded by Wigan Area Health Authority and five funded by public donations. Only the terminally ill go into the hospice but on two days a week old people go for a meal, a bath and an afternoon out.
